title: What is the most important when developing easy to use products? - Quora

response.answer_text: To be successful as a commercial product/business, and not just an impressive ‘design’ exercise, your Product must do the following: Provide customers with a unique set of outcomes / benefits that they can’t get anywhere elseCustomers are willing to pay a higher price for these benefitsThe product evolves and stays aligned with your customers and competitors — sometimes you lead, and sometimes you follow.So there’s much more to a successful product than just being easy-to-use. PS - Remember that sometimes customers don’t want easy-to-use. Here’s an interesting story by Don Norman about Korean consumer products: “I recently toured a department store in South Korea… I found the traditional "white goods" most interesting: … The Korean products seemed more complex than the non-Korean ones, even though the specifications and prices were essentially identical. "Why?" I asked my two guides, .. "Because Koreans like things to look complex, it is a symbol: it shows their status.” [ Don Norman, from Simplicity Is Highly Overrated ] onward >

One of the most important things to realise is that people use products in different ways. Take a restaurant menu. Someone who has never been to that restaurant before should be able to quickly and easily choose from the most popular things in the restaurant.But the menu must also keep people coming back with other options and things to try.That is, get people started easily, but also remember, let people do more later to keep them using it.
